moves.1. e4: Breeze through the setup and watch the action start happening around move 10.
moves.1... Nf6 2. Nc3 d6 3. d4 g6 4. Be3 Bg7 5: when threatened consider an additional attack.
moves.10. e5 Nxd5 11. Bxd5 c6: Here. Ignoring the attack on the bishop and focusing on applying pressure to e7.
moves.12. Re1 cxd5 13. exd6: Now black must dispose of the pawn or a potential fork or promotion can take place...
moves.13... Qxd6: ...but taking the pawn forks queen and rook.
moves.14. Bxe7 Qb6 15. Bxf8: If black responds taking the bishop with the king it'll just seal the deal...
moves.15... Kxf8 16. Qb4+:
Black resigns knowing that next is 
16. ... Kg8
17. Re8+ Bf8 for the block
18. Qxf8#

I think my improvement in this game was 12. Re1. I'm still not sure how I figured that out. Reviewing the game I was surprised when I saw what I had done. It's definitely encouraged me to think more unorthodox.
